Params: {1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory1169.jpg'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Madam Monzano', 3: "They've been holding out for more than three hours since entering that high-pollution zone?", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Madam Monzano', 3: "Yes, so far it's the top performer of this entire batch.", 4: '1'}
{3: "Monzano reviews the combat logs recovered from the fallen Constructs' data chips and lets out a satisfied murmur."}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lilith', 3: 'At the current pace, the next wave of frames will soon be ready to operate across an even larger combat zone.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Lilith', 3: 'Data gathered in battle can further refine our built-in shielding system...', 4: '2'}
{3: "They speak of the previous mission as if it's no big deal, as though the loss in combat strength barely matters."}
{2: 'Madam Monzano', 3: "Don't be fooled by a fleeting victory...", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Madam Monzano raises her head from the terminal and, in her usual manner, delivers a cautionary reminder.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Lilith', 3: '...Because Recall is the most vital step on the path to success.', 4: '2'}
{3: 'She understands exactly where her aunt is headed and cuts her off with a succinct reply.'}
{2: 'Madam Monzano', 3: "You have no right to be impatient, Eleanor. Don't forget, this is all for your benefit.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Madam Monzano', 3: 'Everything evolves—and the Punishing Virus is no exception.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Madam Monzano', 3: 'Even if we manage to create frames that can withstand those intense conditions for a while, a single, more potent outbreak could still wipe out all our progress.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Madam Monzano', 3: 'Even... our very Memory itself.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Madam Monzano', 3: 'How could I ever stand by and let my beloved niece—my prized Test Subject One—throw her life away for nothing?', 4: '1'}
{3: 'She takes pride in the aura of authority she commands.'}
{2: 'Lilith', 3: "If humanity truly has a shot at immortality, then you're our Prometheus, Aunt. As for me, I'll settle for being your stepping stone on the path to godhood.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Madam Monzano', 3: 'Speak your mind. Hiding your thoughts from me is your greatest offense.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Lilith keeps her head bowed, trying to appease that towering pride—yet her disguise is swiftly stripped away.'}
{2: 'Lilith', 3: 'This latest mission... shows me that the Recall technology is truly within reach.', 4: '2'}
{3: 'She lifts the third chip in her hand and reveals it to Monzano, her movements unhurried and deliberate.'}
{2: 'Lilith', 3: "By establishing a direct hardware link, Mako-3 manages to implant a fragment of Memory into another Construct's wreckage, rousing it—if only for a moment.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Madam Monzano', 3: 'A direct hardware link? We can replicate that approach in our lab without much trouble.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Madam Monzano shoots Lilith a disapproving glare.'}

{2: 'Lilith', 3: "So the real issue lies in the medium of transmission. With our current wireless methods, we simply can't transfer all the data from the M.I.N.D. back to the central hub intact.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Lilith', 3: 'I keep thinking... why not use a different medium for the transfer?', 4: '2'}
{3: 'Her words carry little certainty. Lilith simply frames her remarks as suggestions, subtly steering the conversation at precisely the right moments.'}
{2: 'Madam Monzano', 3: 'What medium? ', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Lilith', 3: "Punishing Virus. Aunt's Construct can handle the viral breach, though how long it holds out depends on the quality of its internal shielding.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Lilith', 3: "The Punishing Virus carries information—and in highly contaminated areas, it's absolutely pervasive...", 4: '2'}
{3: 'Lilith drops a subtle hint. She knows all too well that as long as there are enough backup test subjects, her aunt will accept any risk.'}
{3: 'Monzano must prove herself right this time—she refuses to be outdone by Kurono.'}
{2: 'Madam Monzano', 3: "So, you're suggesting we run a short-range Memory transfer test between a Construct and its backup frame in a high-density environment?", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Lilith', 3: 'Precisely.', 4: '2'}

{3: 'Exposing additional samples to high concentrations of the Punishing Virus is the ideal way to lure the Ascension-Network into play. Lilith doesn\'t mind orchestrating a few so-called "successful accidents" for her aunt.'}
{2: 'Madam Monzano', 3: 'Do you remember how you once ruled the card table...?', 4: '1'}
{3: 'With an almost imperceptible smile, Monzano smoothly steers the conversation in a new direction.'}
{2: 'Lilith', 3: 'Those days are long gone.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Lilith', 3: 'Even if the world has turned upside down... standing by your side is what gives me purpose now, Aunt.', 4: '2'}
{3: "Following the chips' logic—that's how she secures her wins."}
{2: 'Madam Monzano', 3: "What I'm trying to say is... that bold imagination of yours—the one that shatters every convention—is exactly why you can read every card player's mind.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Madam Monzano', 3: "I'm glad to see that you haven't let your skills go to waste.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Lilith', 3: "Your life's work is guiding humanity's evolution, Aunt... it's a true privilege to lend you any insight I can.", 4: '2'}
{3: 'Lilith remains lost in memories of the City of Entertainment, flashing an almost childlike smile in gratitude for the praise.'}
{3: 'She gently presents the chip with both hands, excitement dancing in her eyes.'}
{2: 'Madam Monzano', 3: "Let's file away this leftover combat data from Mako-3 for the time being.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Madam Monzano takes the chip from Lilith, then slots it into the central hub with a resolute click.'}
{3: 'It holds the shattered memories and combat records of more than a thousand fallen "volunteers".'}
{3: "The longing for Babylonia, the dream of reclaiming Earth, and even the smallest flickers of emotion... they're all stored in these tiny chips."}
{3: "Yet that newly added fragment holds a foreboding secret—a piece of Lilith's own backup hidden deep within her deep M.I.N.D."}
{2: 'Lilith', 3: "If I recall correctly, you're about to unveil the official findings of the Construct experiment, right Aunt?", 4: '2'}
{3: 'Sensing that brief lull in the tension, she dares to say something that would usually be deemed an overstep.'}
{2: 'Madam Monzano', 3: "We're nowhere near where we need to be.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'The veteran operator swiftly regains their composure, offering a response guided by sharp, unerring judgment.'}
{2: 'Madam Monzano', 3: 'But today truly is a day to celebrate...', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Madam Monzano', 3: "You know, I've never bothered with Babylonia's entertainment district. In fact... that sort of pandering makes my stomach turn.", 4: '1'}
{3: "Madam's demeanor softens a bit, but Lilith understands exactly what she's hinting at."}
{3: "San Lorenzo, tucked beneath the Dominik Memorial Plaza's main deck, is an upscale entertainment hub established by the elite socialites who once graced Las Prados."}
{3: "They claim it's a grand tribute to Madam Monzano for her role in the Great Evacuation, but in truth, it's merely an excuse to indulge their own whims."}
{2: 'Madam Monzano', 3: 'Well, since the mission is a success, why not indulge me with a drink tonight?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Madam Monzano', 3: "After all, I'm curious to see if my niece's mixology skills have dulled.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'She teases with a casual air, allowing a sliver of her usual hauteur to slip away.'}
{3: "Lilith moves forward, slipping her arm through her aunt's like an excited child."}
{2: 'Lilith', 3: "Don't worry—I've got every single one of those classic recipes down pat!", 4: '2'}
{3: 'They make their way toward the exit, savoring a hard-earned respite after intense battles and experiments.'}
{3: 'Lilith thinks back to the day she first saw Babylonia in all its glory.'}
{3: 'This massive shell endures the fiercest cosmic radiation and tumbling debris, granting its inhabitants an unyielding sanctuary.'}
{3: 'But strength brings isolation—and for anything that craves unbridled growth, a sealed space is the perfect breeding ground.'}
{3: 'Petri dishes, test samples, microbial cultures—each one is absolutely vital.'}
{3: 'Monzano and Lilith enter the elevator bound for the entertainment wing.'}
{1: '999', 2: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory843.jpg', 3: '0', 4: '0.3', 5: '2'}
{1: '1', 3: 'No one seems to notice that the data central hub—tied into the shipwide network—is pulsing with a faint, unsettling crimson glow.'}
